intro: Poa holciformis, commonly known as silver hair grass, is a perennial grass species native to the colder regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is characterized by its slender, silver-tipped leaves and dense, tufted growth habit. This plant typically thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and other aquatic or semi-aquatic habitats. Its inflorescence consists of a single spikelet that is often covered in a dense layer of silky hairs. Poa holciformis plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
